DOCUSATE SODIUM

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Administration
  • Cautions
  • Unlicensed use
  • Less suitable for prescribing
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Chronic constipation,

By rectum

  • For adults
    Up to 500 mg daily in divided doses, adjusted according to response.
  • For adults
    120 mg for 1 dose.
  • For children 6 months–1 year
    12.5 mg 3 times a day, adjusted according to response, use paediatric oral solution.
  • For children 2–11 years
    12.5–25 mg 3 times a day, adjusted according to response, use paediatric oral solution.
  • For children 12–17 years
    Up to 500 mg daily in divided doses, adjusted according to response.

Adjunct in abdominal radiological procedures,

By rectum

  • For adults
    400 mg, to be administered with barium meal.
  • For adults
    120 mg for 1 dose.

Removal of ear wax,

To the ear

  • For adults
    (consult product literature).

Pharmacokinetics

Oral preparations act within 1–2 days; response to rectal administration usually occurs within 20 minutes.

Advice when patient is pregnant

With oral use or rectal use

Not known to be harmful—manufacturer advises caution.

Contra indications

Known side effects

Specific side effects

notKnown: abdominal cramp, diarrhoea (excessive use), hypokalaemia, rash, abdominal cramp, diarrhoea (excessive use), hypokalaemia, rash,

Directions for administration

With oral use in children

For administration by mouth, solution may be mixed with milk or squash.

Cautions regarding administration

  • With oral use: do not give with liquid paraffin
  • With oral use: excessive use of stimulant laxatives can cause diarrhoea and related effects such as hypokalaemia
  • With rectal use: do not give with liquid paraffin
  • With rectal use: excessive use of stimulant laxatives can cause diarrhoea and related effects such as hypokalaemia
  • With rectal use: rectal preparations not indicated if haemorrhoids or anal fissure

Unlicensed use

With oral use in children

Adult oral solution and capsules not licensed for use in children under 12 years.

Conditions when less suitable for prescribing

When used by ear

Ear drops less suitable for prescribing.

Prepared medicinal forms of DOCUSATE SODIUM

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Capsule
Oral solution
Ear drops
Enema
